intro: Meiocarpidium oliverianum, commonly known as the Oliver's meiocarpidium, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the family Equisetaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a slender, unbranched stem with whorled leaves. The plant exhibits a primitive reproductive structure, with sporangia clustered in specialized structures called strobili. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for studying plant evolution and conservation.
